bayou.async

Class AsyncBundle<T,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.async.AsyncBundle<T,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - value type of child tasks
    R - value type of the bundle
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Async<R>

    public class AsyncBundle<T,R>
extends Object
implements Async<R>
    Bundles multiple parallel Async<T> tasks as one Async<R> action.

    An AsyncBundle<T,R> consists of multiple child tasks of type Async<T> ; the bundle itself is an Async<R> , which completes when all or some of the tasks are completed (determined by the trigger function).

    For common usages, see static methods anyOf(), allOf(), someOf(). For example 

         Stream<Async<String>> tasks = ...;
     Async<List<String>> bundle = AsyncBundle.someOf(tasks, 2);
     // the bundle succeeds as soon as 2 of the tasks succeeds

    Trigger Function

    The trigger function determines when and how the bundle completes. The input to the function is the results from currently completed tasks; the output of the function can be one of:

    • return null
      the bundle is not yet completed; awaiting more task completions
    • return `r` (non-null, type R)
      the bundle completes with success value `r`
    • throw `e`
      the bundle completes with failure exception `e`

    The bundle first invokes the trigger function with an empty list, then with a list of one result after the first task completion, and so on, until the bundle completes.

    Cancellation

    When a bundle completes, the remaining uncompleted tasks are cancelled; they are no longer needed by the bundle.

      • anyOf

        public static <T> AsyncBundle<T,T> anyOf(Stream<Async<T>> tasks)
        Create a bundle that succeeds as soon as any one of the tasks succeeds.

        The bundle fails if none of the tasks succeeds.

        This method is similar to someOf() with successThreshold=1.

      • allOf

        public static <T> AsyncBundle<T,List<T>> allOf(Stream<Async<T>> tasks)
        Create a bundle that succeeds if all of the tasks succeeds.

        The bundle fails as soon as one of the task fails.

        This method is similar to someOf() with successThreshold=number_of_tasks.

      • someOf

        public static <T> AsyncBundle<T,List<T>> someOf(Stream<Async<T>> tasks,
                                                int successThreshold)
        Create a bundle that succeeds as soon as a number of the tasks succeeds.

        When the number of tasks that have succeeded reaches successThreshold , the bundle succeeds, with the list of values from these tasks.

        The bundle fails if successThreshold becomes unreachable (because too many tasks have failed). See triggerOf(successThreshold, taskCount) for details.

      • triggerOf

        public static <T> FunctionX<List<Result<T>>,List<T>> triggerOf(int successThreshold,
                                                               int taskCount)
        Return a simple trigger function that's based the number of success results.

        Define failureMax=taskCount-successThreshold . Define successCount/failureCount as number of success/failure results. The trigger function behaves as the following

        • if(successCount >= successThreshold)
          Return the list of values from success results. The bundle succeeds.
        • else if(failureCount > failureMax)
          Throw an OverLimitException (limitName="failureMax"). The bundle fails.
        • else
          Return null. The bundle is not yet completed.

        Note that successThreshold is impossible to reach if successThreshold>taskCount . In that case the trigger function fails on any input because failureCount>failureMax is always true. The bundle therefore fails immediately on construction.

        Parameters:
        taskCount - total number of tasks in the bundle
